origin_dialogue: I don't like the looks of that.
I don't think that's going to work.
Well, I've reviewed your chart, little girl.
And the bad news is, we're gonna have to remove your brainÖ
...strap it into an armored battle tank and make it shoot down innocent civilians with its concentrated psychic death beam!
I'm gonna kill you so much.
The good news is that your insurance is going to cover the whole thing, so--
Heyyy, is it getting warm in here?
No, I'm just trying to set you on fire through this stupid hat!
What a delightfully mean little brain you have. Just what we want!
Here, do me a favor. Tell me if you think this smells like... your DOOM! Heh heh.
You're a stubborn little ball of phlegm, ain't ya?
Well, that head cold won't protect you forever, little girl, and when it's gone you'll be sneezing a different tune!
A tune in the key of... BRAINS! Ha ha ha!
Now just what in the sam hill do you thing you're doing in there?
I was just looking for a way out.
Didn't think you'd get to the end so fast.
Dang! I didn't think you'd get to the end at all!
But I'm always glad to see a soldier come back from the field alive.
You surprised me out there, kid.
Now if you'll excuse me, I gotta go back in.
I left some good men back there!
It is I, the creature whose spirit was once--
Um, over here. Behind you? Yes.
The creature whose spirit was once enslaved by the evil one.
You have unchained my soul, and now I shall repay you, powerful human child!
Oh, uh... great! Well okay, show me what you did to my friend Lili!
By the drowned spirit of Oblongata, it is done!
Ahhh, oh, so tacky... IÖ can't... look... directly at it!
This guy needs a Duffle Bag Tag.
This Hat Box needs a Hat Box Tag.
I need the Purse Tag here.
I need the Steamer Trunk Tag for this guy.
Suitcase Tag.  That's what I need here.
What's going on! What's that sound?
Oh the insane asylum just blew up. But don't worry. Mr. Pokeylope helped me save all the brains before it fell down.
Sam? Is that you? It's me, Linda. From the lake?
Linda. I haven't seen you in ages. You look so... different.
Uh, yeah. I've put on a little weight.
Ah, you know I don't mind that onnnnne bit.
Oh, Sam. You haven't changed at all!
And so, that brings us to the end.
Where, as you can clearly see, the personal demons causing my negative behavior have all been eradicated, leaving me sane once again.
This is also corroborated in CAT scan number three, on page fifty-nine of your handouts.
On a personal note, I would just like to reiterate how extremely, extremely sorry I am for stealing all of your brains, and trying to take over the world.
But this camp is all about education, and I know I, for one, learned plenty.
Thanks to that guy right there. Come on up here, Raz!
We endeavor to build strong minds here, with the power to lift things, to see things, to burn things.
But it's a special quality of your heart, not your mind, that truly makes a great Psychonaut.
We did not give it to him.
He got it from someone else, long before he came here.
But we CAN give him this, to honor his mind, his courage, and his heart.
Son, we do not normally ask this of someone so young, but it is obvious to us all that you are not average.
Okay, let's be perfectly clear about this. That was the best summer of my whole entire life.
Hey, the summer's not over yet! We can hang out for a couple of weeks still.
My family's out on the East Coast. Where's yours?
Well, you'd better go. Your dad's waiting for you.
Children, it's an emergency. There's been another kidnapping!
I was here the whole time. You saw me.
No, this time we know who it is, and that's what scares us.
Truman Zanotto, the Grand Head of the Psychonauts.
Sir, can you teleport this many of us back to headquarters?
Hey, what are you people doing in my kitchen? Now git!
Don't worry about your dad, darling. We'll get him back.
Yes, after all, we'll have Razputin helping us.
Now how could we do this without our anti-kidnapping specialist?
I've taught you everything I can, Son.
Now you go show them. Show them all.

Good news! You have enough PSI Cards /PsiCard/ to build a new PSI Challenge Marker! /Marker/ Just buy a PSI Core /PsiCore/ at the Camp Store and bring it to Ford Cruller /FordNinja/ so he can make you one!

Congratulations! You found a loose PSI Card! [image of card] Collect nine of these and you can build a PSI Challenge Marker [image of marker] out of them, but you'll need to get a PSI Core [image of core] from the Camp Store, and a little help from Ford Cruller. [image of ninja Ford]
You just found a PSI Challenge Marker! /Marker/ Every time you find one of these, your PSI Cadet Rank goes up! Rank up enough and you'll get more PSI powers!
Hm. I'm not getting anything. I must be out of range or something.
Man, these things smell terrible. Am I sure I want to do this?
Yes, I want to go back to the real world that badly.
No, I think I'll stay in this mind for a while longer.
I don't want to crack open these Smelling Salts unless I'm in a mental world, and I REALLY want to get out. They smell pretty bad.
Collect 100 figment points and you'll be promoted! If you get promoted to a high enough rank, you will earn new Psychic Abilities!
You can look at all the figments you've collected in your JOURNAL /Journal/

Your first Arrowhead! /Arrowhead/  Arrowheads are made of Psitanium, a rare psychoreactive mineral, which makes them very valuable. You can use Arrowheads to buy items at the camp store and other places you find.
The World Shall Taste my Eggs!
Hey, can we talk about this friendship bracelet?
No. It's embarrassing enough that I made it. Just put it away and shut up.
Hm. I don't think I want to put this bracelet on just yet. I think Lili and I need to talk about our relationship first.
I don't want to show anyone this bracelet. People will think we're totally boyfriend-girlfriend.
I'd like you to meet Mr. Pokeylope.
No, I can't mess around with Mr. Pokeylope. I've got to give him back to Sheegor right away!
Don't worry, Mr. Pokeylope. I'll get you back to Sheegor right away.
This is that button Sasha gave me. It's a clue to the location of his secret lab.
No, I don't want to lose this button. I might not get into Sasha's secret lab without it.
Hey, that's a pretty sweet sound there homey. Why don't you come jam with us some time?
Now that's the darndest harmonica I ever heard. That could be just the sound to take this band in the prog-rock direction I was hoping for.
Hmmm. A horn section might be just what we need.
Sheegor, please! Open a window if you're going to do that.
I think I have to be closer to the shore for Linda to hear it.
I'm not going to wear my costume here. People will think I'm crazy!
Man, I can see why Pokeylope loves this cake. It looks so moist and delicious.
Come on Mr. Pokeylope. Come and get your cake!
Hey, would you mind if I just ate this cake myself?
Come on, Brainless Milla. Time to blow out the candles!
Hey, if I shoved this cake in your face right now, you wouldn't be able to do anything as revenge.
Not right away, no. But a revenge that painful would take lots of planning anyway.
Hmmm. I'm not picking up anything. Must not be any deep arrowheads nearby.
I can't wait to use Sasha's Psychic Portal Door and jump inside someone's head!
...for the good of the mission I mean.

In accordance with Section 3, Paragraph 1 of the "Young Minds Protection Act," any device created for the purpose of invasive psychic procedure must have built-in safeguards which make its use upon anyone under the age of eighteen (18) impossible.
Now don't pull that out while I'm physically near by, or I'm telling you I'm gonna eat it!
Hey, why don't you just take a little nibble of that and see if I can taste it too?
Agent Cruller. Do you have any advice on the current situation?
I need to regroup back at HQ.
Talk to me when you want me to put you back where you were.
Now don't wander off too far or I'll forget, and you'll have to go back there yourself.
Need your analysis on a hostile.
Can I change the color of my Levitation Ball?
Nothing more to report at this time.
Have you ever seen a plant with eyes and teeth?
Oh, yeah. The kind that's impervious to attack when it's curled up? Hate those.
You gotta walk up just close enough to wake them up, and then PSI Blast 'em, real quick!
Ah, anything works on those guys. You can punch 'em, PSI Blast 'em...
It's fun to set fire to them or confuse 'em too. Heh heh heh.
Pick 'em up with TK and throw 'em. Make yourself invisible and sneak up on them.
What about those censors that shoot stuff?
Oh, you gotta grab those guys with your Mental Focus Lock, then you can jump left or right to avoid their shots, while PSI Blasting them from a distance.
What about the really big, burly censors?
It's best if they can't see you, so go invisible when they come around.
Or burn them, or hit them with a confusion grenade if you're going for entertainment value.
What if there's, like, a million, tiny censors. All over you?
Ah, the Palm Bomb! Just jump up in the air and then punch!
You'll come down so hard those little guys just pop like popcorn!
Have you ever been grabbed by a sucker fish?
Oh, they can give you a nasty hickey. But if you jump twice and spin, you might be able to shake them off a little quicker.
The crayfish in the lake are bigger than what we got back home.
That's the Psitanium in the water. Makes a lot of the animals around here a little different.
At least those crayfish are fun to punch!
Have you ever been confused by a rat?
All the time, until I figured out that if you firestart them, they don't set off a cloud of confusion.
In Lungfishopolis, I'm really big, but there are these tanks...
Do what any self-respecting monster would do!
Pick 'em up! Throw them at something! Boom!
Ha! But if you're surrounded, don't forget your shield. And try to time it right.
Airplanes can be a pain, can't they?
Well you gotta shield until you see an opening, and then PSI Blast 'em out of the sky!
Were you watching those Electro Trucks?
Yeah, RUN AWAY. That's my advice there. PSI Blast them from a distance, or run around the side of them and smack them with your monster claw.
What about a really big turret with shots you couldn't dodge?
Shield! After your enemy takes a shot, advance. When you see them about to shoot again, shield up! Get real close that way, and you can take any shot you want.
Did you know that this camp has a bear problem?
Oh, not just any bears, but bears that have been mutated by Psitanium.
When you see that TK claw come out you have to dodge it quick.
And PSI Blast those bears from a distance, or set their tails on fire.
What do you do when you hear a cougar?
Go invisible quick. Those mutant PSI cougars can firestart at quite a distance, but they can't burn what they can't see.
And also, if you pick them up with TK you can actually distract them for a little bit, and use that to your advantage.
What about those creepy guys who pull you under ground?
Oh, be careful with people's nightmares, son.
They'll pull you into their nightmare world and never let go.
You gotta feed them some of their own medicine.
Avoid their grab attacks and try to hurt them to the point that they split open.
And then grab any chunks of their victims that you can find--use TK to throw them into the gaping hole and that should choke up its system.
When it turns to glass you can shatter it with one good punch.
I've got these little thistle girls attacking me.
They're only invulnerable when they're spinning, but if you can't wait, try fire.
These hell-hounds keep setting me on fire.
Now, if a dog did that to me, I'd shoot it. From a distance. With my PSI Blast.
There are these mean little Harpies in Gloria's mindÖ
Shoot! Shoot 'em. Blast them in the head. We're trying to save the world here, not start an aviary!
How would you kill a really big walking snail with a cannon?
Well, remember you can tumble fast when you're using your mental focus...
That should help you avoid their cannonballs.
And when you get up close, punch them, and when they're all sealed up like a pill bug...
Light the fuse on their head and see what happens when that cannon goes off inside their armor.
And when you're tired of that, pick them up with TK and throw them in the water. Snails can't swim! Hee hee!
That Tiger wrestler's got a mean pounce.
Yeah, but it's not so mean if you shield at the right moment.
And if you're invisible then he's just out of luck.
The Dragon wrestler has this roar that glues me to the floor.
That's the thing. You gotta be off the floor when that happens. As soon as he starts to let out a roar, you jump as high as you can and PSI Float. Then he can't get you.
Well, I mean. That's really one word isn't it?
Oh, well if you're going to use a hyphen, I mean--
It's a hyphenated word. One, hyphenated word. Like, um, half-wit.
Watch his shadow, and when you see him coming down, turn on your shield for a real back-breaking landing.
Yeah, that concentration yap he's giving don't mean a thing if you can hit him with a nice confusion grenade. While he's trying to remember his name, he's vulnerable.
How do I kill that armless guy with the swords in his mouth?
Ah youth. I remember the first time I asked that very question.
You can't kill something like that. But you might be able to use his weapons to your own advantage.
Once his swords go into the wall, I'll bet you could swing on them in that way you do so well.
Hellish bunnies spewed forth from meat grinders? Ring a bell?
At this point, I just say beat the heck out of em. Something like that shouldn't even exist!
You've been very helpful. That's all I need.
This would be a good place to be on your ball.
Your ten-year-old mind can set fires. And I have to tell you to do that?
It never hurts, in situations like this, to be invisible.
Don't forget your shield! It's a real life saver!
Clairvoyance can help you see what other people, animals, or things can see.
Why don't you confuse 'em? Just for laughs!
Your enemies can't kill what they can't see.
Have you considered setting fire to everything?
Keeping your target locked will enable you to focus your powers better, and perform better evasive maneuvers!
Why fight someone when you can confuse them from a distance and let them fight themselves?
Hope that makes you feel pretty.
Well, if you're up for some experimental training, you should go see Sasha in his lab, under the GPC. Should be marked on your map.
Looks like you need some better firepower. Better come see me in my lab for your Marksmanship Merit Badge.
Go take Sasha's marksmanship training! Why else did I give you that learner's permit?
Well, now that your mind is a deadly weapon, why not go teach that garbage-spitter a lesson.
The one in your vision. Not Sasha.
Well it is about time you got some Levitation instruction.
Go take a canoe out to see Agent Vodello. She's teaching class right now.
I'm a little worried about your foil-headed friend. Now he's not alone!
I mean more and more kids are acting just like him. Sitting inside on such a nice day, watching TV up in the lodge.
I'm afraid something very wrong is going on.
Better get back to that vision you had in the Brain Tumbler, and use your Levitation to get a closer look.
Why are you just standing here when you should be running down to the lake to make sure your girlfriend isn't being kidnapped by the monster that lives in the water?
Hey, we are just good friends.
Oh, well. That changes everything. Just let her get eaten then.
Get to the end of the docks and get in that bathysphere quick! Before that fish gets away!
Dodge that garbage it's spitting out!
And when it's sucking it back up, bust open one of those nail boxes and see how it likes the taste of those!
Take that little door you found in Sasha's lab and use it on the monster.
We have to get in it's head if we're going to find out where it took the girl!
We have to get back to the other side of the lake. That's where Oleander took the girl.
We're by the old, abandoned insane asylum. I'll bet Oleander has his headquarters up inside.
And keep your eyes peeled for stolen brains.
The thief might have dropped some along the way.
I'll bet those crows can see where some of them are...
Go into this guard's mind, and see if you can find a way to make him open the gate!
Let's find a way into that asylum!
We have to get by that creepy guard and take the elevator upstairs.
I'll bet that's where Oleander has the girl.
Maybe you could make some kind of a disguise...
What are we doing down here? We need to be up in the tower, trying to free your girlfriend!
Try to shoot those rats before they get too close!
Keep moving up! We gotta get to the top!
Oh, watch out for that guard crow.
I'll bet he might not be too alert if you smacked him with a confusion grenade.
Just steer clear of the nutbag in the shower cap.
Those words are just good advice, no matter where you are.
But this guy especially, because he's protected by a powerful shield.
We need to free the turtle hostage. Perhaps that chocolate cake could be deployed in a rescue capacity.
He's coming for the cake! Lure him under that hatch in his cage, and then use telekinesis to lift him out!
Let's give this turtle back to that sad girl with the oven mitts on.
Use Telekinesis to put that little turtle's brain in that tank's cockpit!
Let's help Sasha and Milla blast your girlfriend out of that chair!
Why don't you just do what Sasha said. Listen to your teacher, young man!
Well, you might get your merit badge a little faster if you turn up the censor output all the way...
You gotta find all those leaks that are squirting out censors, and take 'em out!
And when you're fighting these guys, don't forget to lock your mental focus on them for accuracy.
Those little censors seem to be restoring the big guy's health.
You gotta shut down the leaks the little censors are coming out of!
Don't forget to hold mental focus while you're blasting!
Locking focus on him will also make it easier to circle around and get behind him!
Do whatever Milla says, young man. You're in her classroom now.
Keep trying to get higher, and if you see any of those big rings, keep 'em spinning.
Don't forget you can still PSI Blast when your on the ball.
Ranged weapons are always useful in a race.
Use your PSI Float in those columns of bubbles to float up to the top of the room, and then figure out how to turn the big fan on.
Let's check out what's inside that caravan. Don't be afraid of your past.
Hey, you heard the man. Follow the bunny.
Watch out for those killer plants. You can't hurt them when they're all coiled up.
Stay on the ground if you want to fight, but you could probably avoid some of it if you took the higher route.
We gotta get up to the top of that vine tower!
You can hide behind those pillars to break his target-locking on you.
Wait until he rears up to charge, and then blast him in his soft pink underbelly! Ha!
And then when he's upside down, get him!
Get as high as you can, and float in shooting!
Well, if I were a monster, 50 stories high, I'd probably start smashing stuff.
You heard 'em. Bust open that prison over there.
The Coach is obviously controlling the Lungfish's mind, so he must have planted something in here to amplify his thoughts and subjugate the populace.
It's probably the enormous communications tower on that distant island.
Smash your way through town and take down that tower.
Your PSI Shield would protect you in that tunnel, and maybe even do some damage to the emitters.
We have to find someone to pilot this blimp for us so we can get over this dam!
Get up on top of these buildings and take out those planes!
You can use those super tankers to get across the channel.
If you pay attention to this guy's actions, you can tell how he's about to attack.
Wait for him to let down his shield, and then attack.
And don't forget to use your own shield!
Okay, now get up that tower and take out the communications equipment at the top!
And why don't you just pick up those pesky tanks and throw them at each other?
Open the fridge! Like he said!
Use your Clairvoyance power on that loony. I'd like to see what color the sky is in his world.
That is the worst road crew disguise I have ever seen.
But if it works for them, it should work for us. We just gotta hold up one of those signs.
Hmmm. Looks like we'll need some flowers as a disguise.
The plant place. It's like a garden, but more shrubby and scientific.
Let's search this place for flowers.
If you used Clairvoyance on the that crow feather, you might get a birds-eye view of the situation.
You could probably burn those big vines off that mausoleum.
We have to find a way through the sewers to the Book Depository.
I'll bet if we could see what that G-Man sees, we would know the right combination.
I forgot the combo. If you forgot it too, we're going to have to make that G-Man come out again.
Try your Clairvoyance on those security cameras. I'll bet they can see in the dark.
Looks like they got a sniper. If you time it right, your shield should get you through there.
Use your Clairvoyance on one of those helicopters and we'll be able to search for the Milkman from the air.
That telephone would be a good disguise for getting up to those phone company wires.
Let's make sure we're out of sight before she makes it to the door.
And when she opens it, take her out!
You can't see in the dark but she can!
Clairvoyance will let you see what she sees!
And turn on your shield when you see her throwing stuff at you!
Let's go back to the dressing rooms and see if we can't get this Bonita person to take the stage.
Somewhere in that storage room is a candle that we need.
Let's put this candle in that spotlight so the show can begin!
Well, I think you should go talk to that blowhard up in the balcony and give him a piece of your mind.
Let's give this script to Becky and see if it's any good.
I wonder if those prop doors on the set really work?
I'll bet if you punched that strange spotlight with the faces on it, you could change what's going on on stage.
We have to get up to the catwalks and get rid of that Phantom character.
I'll bet the right script played on the right set would do it!
Let's take that prop magic cloud elevator thing up to the catwalks.
Those spotlights couldn't find you if you were invisible.
Let's turn a light on this guy so we can see who he is.
Let's float up to the catwalks and blind him with those spotlights so he'll let down his guard.
Zig zag on the way up to avoid the fat man's attacks.
Well, we'll never get our troops over that river while the bridge is out.
We need to get a Carpenter to fix it!
If I were there I would use Telekinesis to move the game pieces around.
You can't win a war without soldiers.
Let's go see if we can sign up a standing army.
Put our Militiaman next to Napoleon's soldier piece so they can fight!
Ooh, we gotta get that guy some money before he'll fight.
Heh heh! Let's ransack Fred's parlor!
We gotta go through that building over there and find that guy's Musket!
Okay, we just gotta get that drawbridge down, and get a Hearty Knight to storm Napoleon's stronghold and we'll win.
We gotta get some fancy food for that fat guy to eat.
You didn't even see him. How do you know he's fat?
Why don't you TK a pail on top of em? That will slow 'em down.
We're going to have to infiltrate the grounds of the stronghold and see if we can't get the drawbridge down for fatty.
Buy all the paintings you can, and look for hooks to hang them on.
And for crying out loud STAY OFF THE STREET.
You can't outrun that bull. You're going to have to sneak around on side streets.
Maybe you can hide out in a window if those ladies don't see you coming.
Throw a confusion grenade at that Bull. That should buy you some time.
You can TK those spears into that bull, well, see if that slows him down.
Man, get those spears out of Edgar's back! What kind of friend are you?
And see if you can confuse that Matador.
While that Matador thinks he's a bull, he's probably vulnerable like a bull.
Try sticking him with those barbed poles.
You have to TK rubble against rubble!
Break a hole big enough in the first ring so you can get in and set fire to the inner ring.
Then TK a hunk of masonry right on that idiot's brain!
Follow that kid! Don't let him get hurt while your brains are connected!
Use your TK to grab those bunnies! Or try confusing them!
You can't kill those knife throwers. And somebody's already ripped their arms off, but you can swing on their knives once they're stuck in the board.
Next time his cleaver gets stuck in the ground, run up his arm and punch him in his fat head.
Listen to your father! Keep moving or you're going to drown!
Okay, do NOT run up the flaming arms.
Hmm. Try TKing some of your Dad's flaming clubs into the butcher.
And then, if he ends up, say, curled up in agony, THEN you can punch him in his fat head.
Yeah, put your head between your legs and kiss your ass good bye!
Hang onto that power your dad gave you, because it's the only chance we've got.
Don't turn up your nose at recycling. You gather up those PSI Cards, and get yourself some Cores, and come down to my lab and we'll rank you up quick!
Maybe if you were a higher rank, you could get some PSI powers that could help you out.
You can rank up if you collect more figments, sort more emotional baggage, or collect more mental cobwebs.
Not much to do here except clean up all the cobwebs, collect all the figments, and get any vaults that are left.
I don't have time for this!
To view this MEMORY again, check out the MEMORIES page in your JOURNAL. /Journal/
This is a Psychic Arrowhead.  Its raw energy will contribute value to your Arrowheads in small amounts, but I think you'll find they add up over time!
Find 8 items, and you'll be promoted 4 Ranks.
Find the other 8, and get promoted 6 more Ranks!

What were Spanish explorers doing in this valley two hundred years ago? How did they get their boats over the hills and into Lake Oblongata which, at that time, did not even exist? Why did they leave their doubloons here, and why has no person found this one though it has been floating in midair all this time? These are just some of the many unanswered riddles held within this mysterious coin.
Eagle Claw Soup is surprisingly tangy, and promotes the growth of strong fingernails.

Thick helmets like these have been used to protect those who dive in Lake Oblongata, not from the increase in water pressure, but from the hideous creature that is rumored to live in the lake (but is, of course, just an old legend).
The thrilling Origin Issue in which the Psychonauts get their name and design their first costumes. Also introduces the character of "Clyde the Cautious Cougar" who teaches firestarting safety.

This style of pipe was common among more fashion-conscious loggers in the early part of this century, until a high frequency of logger-initiated forest fires led to a mandatory, industry-wide switch to chewing tobacco, and later, bark-flavored chewing gum.

Possibly the most famous of all poultry-based sandwiches, second only to its more glamorous sister, the Chicken Salad Sandwich. The Turkey Sandwich holds a special place in the hearts of food lovers everywhere who crave something that's like Chicken, but not.

Years ago someone thought it would be a fun craft project at camp to make voodoo dolls. We would have fired that teacher had they not ended up in the hospital. If you find one of these dolls PLEASE do not remove and reinsert ANY of the pins.

In the early days of the Psitanium rush, prospectors and miners came from all over to hunt the mysterious "Whispering Rock" so plentiful in this valley. Some were killed in mining accidents, some in claim disputes, but many were simply driven mad by the powerful mineral, and wandered off into the mines, never to be seen again--except for their creepy, bearded heads.
Telescopes like this were once popular among area pirates, until they learned that they could see farther by using Clairvoyance on bird feathers.
Adult squirrels will often coat a regular acorn with a mucilaginous secretion that gives it a shiny, "golden" coat. This sparkly trinket is used to attract possible mates. Warning: do not eat.
I am always losing mine around camp. If you find one please don't scratch it, because I'm running out of spares.

The rare and beautiful Condor Egg. Condors were once plentiful in this valley, but their numbers have been decimated by modern hazards such as power lines, telekinetic grizzly bears, and poachers stealing the eggs out of their nests.
Wasps love fertility idols. Everybody knows it. No one knows why. But it must work because look at how many of them there are!

Enormous, carnivorous, and Psychically mutated, one thing for sure you can say about the valley's prehistoric inhabitants: we are glad they're dead. Nobody wants to see levitating velociraptors. SCARY.
Bringing day old chicken pot pie from the cafeteria doesn't count! I've been fooled twice already, but from now on, you kids better have the real McCoy!

Time. The enemy of us all. Hold a watch to your ear and listen. Tick tock, tick tock... those are the hoof beats of the Reaper's pale horse. "Half past eight, he's at your gate. Quarter to four, a knock on the door." Unwinding is the mortal coil that drives the gears to tick and toil, until at last, it rests, unwound, and we lay silent in the ground.

Your JOURNAL is a great place to see what you've done so far, and plan what you're going to do next. You can use it to SAVE and LOAD your progress, change your OPTIONS, and there's a helpful MAP in the back! Press /StartButton/ to open your JOURNAL.
Use the LEFT /Joystick/ or /DPad/ to navigate the Journal.
On this page, you can see what you've collected in the current area. Make sure to come back here after you've collected some FIGMENTS, so you can look at them up close with the FIGMENT VIEWER option.
This page shows how you're doing in the bigger scheme of things. Also, once you get your SCAVENGER HUNT LIST, this is where you'll keep it.
This page automatically remembers what tasks you're working on. If you're ever unsure what to do next, come back here to jog your memory.
Once you've cracked open a MENTAL VAULT, you'll store the memories you find in here. Come back and watch them as many times as you'd like.

This handy map shows the layout of the camp. Your position is marked with a /RedTriangle/. The next place you should go is marked with a /MapHighlightMark/. If you ever feel like you don't know where to go, come on back and check out your map!
Yes, I want to go back to the real world that badly.
Agent Cruller. Do you have any advice on the current situation?
Airplanes can be a pain, can't they?
Can I change the color of my Levitation ball?
Did you know that this camp has a bear problem?
Have you ever been confused by a rat?
Have you ever been grabbed by a sucker fish?
Have you ever seen a plant with eyes and teeth?
Hellish bunnies spewed forth from meat grinders? Ring a bell?
How do I kill that armless guy with the swords in his mouth?
How would you really kill a big walking snail with a cannon?
I need to regroup back at HQ.
I've got these little thistle girls attacking me.
In Lungfishopolis, I'm really big, but there are these tanks...
Need your analysis on a hostile.
Nothing more to report at this time.
That Tiger wrestler's got a mean pounce.
The Dragon wrester has this roar that glues me to the floor.
The crayfish in the lake are bigger than what we got back home.
There are these mean little Harpies in Gloria's mindÖ
These hell-hounds keep setting me on fire.
Were you watching those Electro Trucks?
What about a really big turret with shots you couldn't dodge?
What about the really big, burly censors?
What about those censors that shoot stuff?
What about those creepy guys who pull you under ground?
What do you do when you hear a cougar?
What if there's, like, a million, tiny censors. All over you.
You've been very helpful. That's all I need.
You are never going to get to rank 100!
Return the four queens to Edgar.
Thorney Towers Home for the Disturbed
Defeat that big monster I saw.
Earn Marksmanship Merit badge from Sasha.
Man that guy is mean looking. Well, not for long!
Man, this is going to take forever at this rate! There has GOT to be a way to make to make the censors come out faster!
Shut down all leaky valves crib face.
This bed is a mess. There are censors coming out of all these pipes. If I shoot the locks off the valves, I should be able to shut down the leaks.
Shut down all leaky valves at the mobile face.
Shut down all leaky valves at the shoe shop.
This face is an even bigger mess than the last. And it smells like feet. Lots of valves to shut down here.
This looks like censor HQ. If I shut down these valves, I should be just about done.
Okay, now that I know how to PSI Blast, I should really go back into that nightmare and teach those censors a lesson.
Get up to the top of that tower and save Dogen!
I should go ask Mr. Cruller for a canoe so I can see Agent Vodello out on her dock.
Earn Levitation Merit Badge from Milla.
Get up to the top floor of this crazy club.
Seems like all the cool stuff is going on up there. Time to levitate.
Beat stupid Bobby Zilch in the Levitation race.
Float up the bubble vents to switch on the big fan.
Those bubbly vents on the side of the room could probably help me get up to the switch at the top.
Float through the hoops to open the door to the party room.
I can float up and down in the center of the room to get those rings spinning. And then after that, I swear, no more jumping through hoops.
Okay, I can punch, I can shoot, I can fly. Time to put an end to this Brain Tumbler nightmare once and for all!
He wants to kidnap psychic children and use their brains as weapons in a secret army of his own creation. Not on my watch, Shorty.
Girlfriend or not girlfriend (and I think right now it would be rushing things to say GIRLFRIEND) I really should save her.
I think I see some glowing footprints up ahead. They might lead to Lili, who I care a lot about, like a buddy.
Enter the Mind of the Lungfish.
My new years resolution is to try to protect these guys better. Otherwise the entire resistance will  soon be vaporized.
I need to destroy all these planes, tanks, beam-cannon trucks, and Iron Lungs before those ships will dock in the harbor so I can get across.
This guard is no help. Hmmm... or is he?
I saw the missing playing cards when I rode into town. I've got to dodge that bull and work my way up the main road to get them, and then give them back to Edgar!
Hold /LeftFlipper/ to lock your mental focus on an object.
Hold down /BlackButton/ to set fire to the targeted object.
You just collected enough PSI Cards to make another PSI Challenge Marker!
Raz is holding an object in his hand. To use a handheld object with someone, walk up to them and press /YButton/
You just found a PSI Challenge Marker! Every time you find one of these, your PSI Cadet Rank goes up! Rank up enough and you'll get new PSI powers!
But you'll need to get a PSI Core from the Camp Store, and a little help from Ford Cruller.
To view this Memory again, check out the Memories page in your Journal.
This Steamer Trunk is lost without his Claim Ticket.  Find it for him and sort this Emotional Baggage out.
This Steamer Trunk Claim Ticket needs to find his partner, the Steamer Trunk.
Watch out for those Censors.  Press /XButton/ to punch them.  Also try jumping then punching.
Here come more Censors.  Try throwing a Confusion Grenade at them. /BlackButton/
Censors again.  This time try Firestarting them. Hold /BlackButton/

Your JOURNAL is a great place to see what you've done so far, and plan what you're going to do next. You can use it to SAVE and LOAD your progress, change your OPTIONS, and there's helpful MAP in the back! Press /StartButton/ to open your JOURNAL.
Arrowheads are made of Psitanium, a rare psychoreactive mineral, which makes them very valuable.  You can use Arrowheads to buy items at the camp store.
But you'll need to get a PSI Core from the Camp Store, and a little help from Ford Cruller
Congratulations! You found a loose PSI Card!  Collect nine of these and you can build a PSI Challenge Marker /Marker/ out of them.
Good news! You have enough PSI Cards to build a new PSI Challenge Marker! /Marker/
Just buy a PSI Core at the Camp Store, and use Agent Cruller's special lab equipment to put the Cards and Core together into a new Marker!
Your first figment! Collect 100 figment points and you'll be promoted. If you get promoted to a high enough rank, you will earn new Psychic Abilities!
This is the only thing I've always known I wanted to do, ever since I was a boy.
Judging by his face, Coach Oleander's been through a lot. I'm sure he'll have tons of stuff to teach me.
If I complete Sasha's advance training, he'll show me how to astrally project myself into people's minds at will, and that's something I'll have to learn if I want to be a Psychonaut.
What did he mean, "Isolation can be a good thing?" What's that have to do with the location of his secret lab? HmmmÖ
I wish that stupid bunny would hold still so I could catch him. What's he doing here anyway?
Okay, I don't know what that big scary thing was, but it has no business being in my mind. I think it's gonna have to die.
Sasha said he'd teach me how to really fight when I'm ready. And I'm ready!
Man. Sasha sure does not like tiffany lamps. Well, I'd be happy to take care of that for him!
I have to mentally focus on just one lamp at a time, and blast them all--One! Two! Three!
Some of the pipes here are way up top. I'm going to have to climb this mobile to shut them down.
Shut down all the factory's leaky valves.
Run from the stamp! Must not forget my mental focus! Hey, those little censors are restoring his health. Not fair! I'll just shut down all the valves on every face to put an end to that!
I have to find a way to get up higher, at least to stop Dogen from screaming. He's ruining my nightmare.
Agent Vodello is one of the world's leading levitators. After her class I should be pretty much the most powerful psychic ever.
Get past that bouncer and into Milla's dance party
Okay, that robot guy looks tough, but once I get a few of these bubble moves down, he'll let me in for sure.
Man, that guy is annoying. And fast. This is going to be a tough race. Then again, Milla didn't say anything about not using PSI Blast.
Okay, I know that's kind of Dogen's brain in there, but I have to remember it's just a dream. It's okay to kill people's brains in a dream.
I have to follow in the Hulking Lungfish's footsteps if I'm ever going to find my really good friend.
I have to dodge that debris and shoot the lungfish while it has it's ugly mouth on the bubble.
Man. I haven't been trained in monster brains yet. Well, I guess I should just go for it. I mean, how different can they be?
If I take out that big psychic relay tower, I'll bet the Coach's psychic presence in this mind will be diminished.
I should bust those guys out of jail. I hope there aren't any really dangerous criminals in there.
If I can block that forcefield while it's off, my little revolutionary friend can get through.
I probably don't have to destroy the WHOLE thing. Maybe just that blinky part up top.
If this version of the Coach has a weakness, then it's got to be pretty small because I can't find it.
Earn Levitation badge in Milla's mind.
Get past that bouncer and into Milla's dance party.
Ride the bubble vents to switch on the big fan.
Follow Dogen's brain down the chute.
Free the Lungfish from the influence of the mysterious Kochamara.
Rendezvous with the dissidents at the dam.
Free the blimp pilot from his prison.
Use blimp to get over dam.
Destroy all planes so the freighters can dock.
Proceed to Tower Island to destroy the radio tower.
Find a disguise for the graveyard.
Use flowers to infiltrate the graveyard.
Take the sewers to the book depository.
Get better view of entire neighborhood.
Get to the top of the tower, like I did in my vision.
Trick the orderly into letting me on the elevator.
Help Gloria control her mood swings.
Get Bonita to take the stage.
Get "Knight of Joy" script from Jasper.
Ride the balloon up to the catwalks.
Help Fred win the battle in his mind.
Recruit a Carpenter to repair the bridges.
Recruit a peasant to fight Napoleon's soldiers.
Restore the hopeless peasant's faith in Fred.
Move the newly-recruited Militiaman piece next to Napoleon's soldier.
Deliver Fred's letter to the hopeless peasant.
Find a way to secure the financial future of the poor peasant's family.
Recruit a Hearty Knight to take Napoleon's stronghold.
Recruit some escargot for the Hearty Knight.
Take snails to the restaurant so the Hearty Knight can have a decent meal.
Move the Hearty Knight into Napoleon's stronghold.
Help Edgar conquer his obsession with bullfights.
Get the Queen of Clubs back to Edgar.
Get the Queen of Hearts back to Edgar.
Get the Queen of Diamonds back to Edgar.
Get the Queen of Spades back to Edgar.
Protect El Odio from Dingo Inflagrante!
Make my way through the upper ruins of the asylum.
Rescue Sasha and Milla's brains from Dr. Loboto.
Revisit minds and collect enough figments to reach Rank 65.
Beat the Giant PSYCHOBLASTER DEATH TANK!
Get to the brain and disarm the tank for good.
Help Coach Oleander destroy the monster inside.
This little guy can teleport you to any previously visited area in the current mental world. Just pick your destination and go!
All figments have a different point value.
Capacity to Confuse Increased! You can store more CONFUSION GRENADES NOW!
You have increased your MAXIMUM PROJECTION DEPTH! Now your ASTRAL PROJECTION has more layers to peel off before you are kicked back to the REAL WORLD.
ASTRAL PROJECTION LAYER RESTORED! Your projection into this mind has deepened by one layer!

Every time you lose all your MENTAL HEALTH, you peel off a layer of your ASTRAL PROJECTION. If you lose all the layers, then you will no longer be able to maintain a projection in this mental world, and you will be kicked out into the real one.
Later, bring the COBWEB DUSTER to Agent Cruller's Sanctuary, where your captured cobwebs can be redeemed for /PsiCard/ PSI CARDS in the MENTAL COBWEB DETANGLER!
The COBWEB DUSTER is a Real World device that can project itself along with you into the Mental World. Aim it at any MENTAL COBWEBS you find, and press /YButton/ to collect the cobweb.

This DOWSING ROD can be used to find deeper, more valuable PSITANIUM ARROWHEADS. Equip the DOWSING ROD and watch its changing color and vibration. This is how it lets you know that you are getting closer to a DEEP ARROWHEAD.
Once in the right spot, press /YButton/ very rapidly to extract the ARROWHEAD from the ground.
COBWEB TROUBLE? The Camp Store sells this handy device for removing pesky MENTAL COBWEBS. Buy your COBWEB DUSTER today!
Collect markers like /OneUp/ to replace layers, and collect markers like /MaxLivesUp/ to increase how many layers you can maintain at once.
Raz has stowed the item in his backpack. To see what's in Raz's backpack, and what merit badges he has, press the BACK button. /BackButton/
I'm ready to go back into the field.
What are you doing here at Whispering Rock?
Sasha says I need to learn how to fight better.
I saw you raking leaves. Was that a disguise?
So what mission are you on down here?
What does all this equipment do?
I'd better go. Lots of work to do.
No, I think I'll stay in this mind for a while longer.
View your current PSI POWERS in this Thought Bubble, or press /DPadLeft/ to see what's in your backpack.
Point to a PSI POWER with the LEFT THUMBSTICK /Joystick/ and then press BLACK /BlackButton/, WHITE /WhiteButton/, or RIGHT TRIGGER /RightFlipper/ to map the selected power to that button.
To pull out an item from your backpack, point to it with the LEFT THUMBSTICK /Joystick/ and then press the /AButton/ button. To return it to your backpack later, press /BButton/.
You have too many items to fit on one page! Use the /DPAD/ to see the rest of your items.

You've just absorbed positive MENTAL HEALTH! Maintaining your mental health is important, because if you run out, you will not be able to maintain your astral projection in this mind, and you'll be kicked back into the REAL WORLD.
Find a "lab coat" for Loboto costume.
Recruit the Carpenter to repair the bridges.
Find a way onto the Carpenter's roof.
Hey, you've finished half of the Scavenger Hunt, so you've qualified for the first half of your prize! Go see Ranger Ford for your big promotion!
Sorry, you haven't found any other teleport points yet.
Use PSI BLAST to shut down the valve.

Please reconnect the controller to controller port
Find 8 items, and you'll be promoted 4 Ranks!
Find 8 more, and get promoted another 4 Ranks!
Could you take me back to camp now?
Could you take me back to the Asylum?
Nothing. I just wanted to make sure you're not dead.
Hey, it looks like you're ready to take on a new psychic power!
Ready to come back and get your new merit badge?
Control speed with LEFT /Joystick/ or use it to change rails when jumping.
Use Smelling Salts to exit this level.
Hey, if you blow that thing on the beach then our Hulking Lungfish friend is going to come up out of the water and take you to the other side of the lake. You sure you want to do that?
PALM MEGABOMB! After you start a PALM BOMB, press /XButton/ as many times as you can before you hit the ground.  The more times you press /XButton/ the higher the bonus damage!
WRECKING BALL! Once you've earned this LEVITATION powerup, your Thought Bubble becomes a deadly weapon at full speed!
CHAIN BLAST! Your PSI Blast will bounce from one enemy to the next, damaging up to 3 nearby enemies at once!
THERMAL DETONATION! Your PYROKINESIS power will now invoke a massive explosion around the target, setting fire to anything nearby!
ADVANCED INVISIBILITY! Invisibility lasts twice as long!
Clairvoyance lets you see through the eyes of another. Try it on a person directly, or on a handheld object that bears this special aura: /ClairvoyanceEye/
Changes the color of your Levitation Ball.
Attracts MENTAL HEALTH and other useful psychic energies.
Replenishes MENTAL HEALTH when opened. Automatically opens when MENTAL HEALTH is gone completely. Very handy!
Used to make PSI CHALLENGE MARKERS.
From now on, useful psychic energy will automatically be drawn towards you from a distance.
Talk to Ford Cruller when you want to do some colorizing.
Use the LEFT /Joystick/ or /DPad/ to navigate the Journal.
On this page, you can see what you've collected in the current area. Make sure to come back here after you've collected some FIGMENTS, so you can look at them up close with the FIGMENT VIEWER option.
This page shows you how you're doing in the bigger scheme of things.  Also, once you get your SCAVENGER HUNT LIST, this is where you'll keep it.

This handy map shows you the layout of the camp.  Your position is marked with a /RedTriangle/.  The next place you should go is marked with a /MapHighlightMark/. If you ever feel like you don't know where to go, come on back and check out your map!
Help Sasha get censors under control.
Get a Marksmanship Learner's Permit from Ford Cruller.
Show Sasha my Marksmanship Learner's Permit.
Earn a real Marksmanship Merit Badge in Sasha's mind.
Get Levitation Merit Badge from Milla Vodello.
Return to the Brain Tumbler in Sasha's Lab.
Get to Kochamara Tower and destroy it.
Find a way to get through the laser-shield tunnel protecting the prison.
Destroy the prison to free the pilot.
Climb the tower to destroy the antenna.
Find the Clairvoyance badge in Boyd's house.
Go to the Graveyard and search the Milkman's Grave.
Find disguise to pass as sewer worker.
Buy a COBWEB DUSTER at the camp store.
Find the candle in the old prop room.
Use candle to light the big spotlight.
Find a way up to the catwalks.
Find the right script and play it on the right set to get access to the catwalks.
Get rid of any "burglars" scampering on the Carpenter's roof.
Recruit another peasant to fight the new soldier.
Move the Snail piece to the restaurant so the Hearty Knight can have a decent meal.
Free the gears and lower the drawbridge to Napoleon's stronghold!

Buy a DOWSING ROD at the camp store.
Find enough DEEP ARROWHEADS with the DOWSING ROD to afford the COBWEB DUSTER.
Bring brains back to Agent Cruller to increase MENTAL HEALTH POTENTIAL!
Brain Found--Must Return to Agent Cruller.
Basic Braining Merit Badge viewable in JOURNAL.
Try the PALM MEGABOMB! Start a PALM BOMB, and then smash /MeleeButton/ as fast as you can!
DOUBLE FINE WOULD LIKE TO THANK
TK EXTENSION! Your TELEKINESIS range has been extended!
ROLLING HAVOC! Wrecking Ball activates as soon as you start rolling on the Levitation Ball!
SENSORY SCRAMBLE! You further cloud your enemies' minds, and Confusion lasts twice as long.
PSYCHIC REGENERATION! Your friends at camp are focusing their energy directly into you, and you'll now slowly regenerate mental health!
INFINITE AMMO! By tapping into the raw power of the nearby Psitanium deposit, you've obtained infinite psychic ammo for PSI Blast and Confusion.
Take log-tunnel to Ford's lab and get a PSI Blast training badge from Ford.
Return to Sasha's Lab with your training badge.
SUPER CHAIN BLAST! Your Chain Blast can now hit up to 6 enemies in a row!

Mount this pole and move up to climb.
You can open a DREAM FLUFF at any time to fully restore your MENTAL HEALTH, and if you lose all your MENTAL HEALTH, they open themselves automatically. Very handy!

Collect reward from Ranger Cruller for completing the Scavenger Hunt!
